intro: Aethionema alidaghenicum, commonly known as the Alidaghen carnation, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
